item.title: Sarah add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Any book that helps a child to form a habit of reading, to make reading one of his deep and continuing needs, is good for him." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information on it." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Some of your griefs you have cured, And the sharpest you still have survived, But what torments of grief you've endured From evils that never arrived." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "For what do we live, but to make sport for our neighbors, and laugh at them in our turn?" -- Jane Austen

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "A good library will never be too neat, or too dusty, because somebody will always be in it, taking books off the shelves and staying up late reading them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Well-read people are less likely to be evil." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Sarah add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read. It was books that taught me that the things that tormented me most were the very things that connected me with all the people who were alive, or who had ever been alive." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Sarah add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Read. Read anything. Read the things they say are good for you, and the things they claim are junk. You'll find what you need to find. Just read." -- Neil Gaiman
